meanings.definition: A plant of the parsley family, with aromatic seeds that are used as a spice.
meanings.sent1: The cumins in the garden have small white flowers.
meanings.sent2: I added cumins to the curry for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: Why did the parsley invite the cumins to the party? Because they spice things up!
meanings.sent4: The aroma of cumins filled the kitchen, making it feel warm and inviting.
meanings.sent5: As I crushed the cumins between my fingers, their fragrance transported me to a spice market.

meanings.definition: The aromatic seeds of the cumin plant, used as a spice in cooking.
meanings.sent1: She sprinkled cumins on top of the salad for a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a pinch of cumins to enhance the taste.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chef always carry cumins in his pocket? In case of a seasoning emergency!
meanings.sent4: The cumins danced in the sizzling pan, releasing their rich aroma.
meanings.sent5: The cumins added a delightful kick to the dish, making it unforgettable.
